required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Study of pCAR-19B in the Treatment of CD19-positive Relapsed/Refractory B-ALL in Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Study of Anti-CD19 CAR-T Therapy (pCAR-19B) in the Treatment of CD19-positive Relapsed/Refractory B-ALL

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I clinical study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of pCAR-19B in patients with relapsed or refractory B-ALL, and to obtain the maximum tolerated dose of pCAR-19B and phase II Recommended dose.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, single-arm, open-label study. The study plans to set up 3 dose groups, adopting a dose-escalating 3+3 design, and plan to recruit about 9-18 subjects with relapsed or refractory B-ALL.pCAR-19B will be infused to the subject by intravenous infusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse events after pCAR-19B infusion [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Therapy-related adverse events were recorded and assessed according to the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, Version 5.0)

primary_outcome.measure: Obtain the maximum tolerated dose of pCAR-19B cells[Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate after pCAR-19B infusion [Effectiveness]
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate includes CR, CRi
AUCS is defined as the area under the curve in 28 days and 90 days
CMAX is defined as the highest concentration of pCAR-19B cells expanded in peripheral blood
TMAX is defined as the time to reach the highest concentration
Cytokines such as hs-CRP, IL-6 levels

arm_group.description: Infusion of pCAR-19B cells by dose-escalating

intervention.description: Drug: pCAR-19B cells； Administration method: intravenous infusion； Subjects will be treated with Fludarabine and Cyclophosphamide before cell infusion.

overall_official.affiliation: Tongji Hospital affiliated to Tongji Medical College of Huazhong University of Science and Technology

facility.name: Tongji Hospital affiliated to Tongji Medical College of Huazhong University of Science and Technology
